data.title: Technology Partners
data.meta_description: Adapture collaborates with industry-leading partners to deliver tailored solutions that drive your business forward.
data.text:
At Adapture, we pride ourselves on the quality of our partnerships. We are highly selective and take a very strategic approach to growing our partner network—only engaging with industry leaders, like those featured in the Gartner Magic Quadrant™. This approach produces best-in-class solutions designed to complement one another in a way that best addresses your business challenges.

Arctic Wolf was founded not just to make cybersecurity better, but to redefine it. Co-founders Brian NeSmith and Kim Tremblay realized that cybercriminals were innovating faster than the industry, and so a fundamentally new approach was needed. The answer to better cybersecurity is not buying and deploying the newest silver bullet solution but developing a complete program that can adapt to the ever-changing security landscape. Arctic Wolf partners with companies to do this by delivering a unique SOC-as-a-service that is tailored to fit exactly what each customer needs.

Aruba, a Hewlett Packard Enterprise company, is a leading provider of mobility and IOT solutions for organizations of all sizes worldwide. Aruba designs and delivers IT solutions that empower organizations to serve GenMobile, a new generation of tech-savvy users who rely on mobile devices for every aspect of work and personal communication, and to harness the power of insights to transform business processes.

Axcient is positioned as a visionary in the 2015 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Disaster Recovery as a Service. Axcient provides straightforward solutions that solve complex technology problems to enable seamless business operations. With data recovery solutions from Axcient, customers enjoy peace of mind, knowing they can protect and recover any files, anywhere.

Check Point Software Technologies Ltd. provides industry-leading security solutions globally, and protects customers from cyberattacks with an unmatched catch rate of malware and other types of attacks. Check Point offers a complete security architecture defending enterprises’ networks to mobile devices, in addition to the most comprehensive and intuitive security management. Check Point’s products and services are sold to enterprises, service providers, small- and medium-sized businesses and consumers, and they secure more than 100,000 businesses and millions of users worldwide.

Citrix helps organizations unlock people’s full potential by creating the space to think, create and innovate. The world of work is changing. It’s time to remove the limits on where and how employees work, and give them the flexibility to work in the way they do best. The best way to tackle this problem? Simplicity. Citrix powers a simple, secure employee experience that enables teams to think, create, innovate, and do their best work.

Cloudamize provides companies powerful tools for optimization and capacity planning for their cloud infrastructure. For companies considering moving infrastructure to the cloud, Cloudamize measures existing workloads, projects the optimal sizing in the cloud to support performance goals, provides total cost of ownership, and supports the migration process by providing the right settings for the new environment. Cloudamize also provides comprehensive monitoring to receive targeted alerts, view detailed system metrics, and examine root cause of issues.

F5 Networks is a leading challenger in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Web Application Firewalls. F5 has taken industry-leading security solutions to the next level with the launch of F5 Silverline—a suite of cloud-based, enterprise-grade application services that offer the same robust capabilities as the award-winning on-premise F5 solutions.

Fortinet is a multinational corporation that develops and markets cybersecurity software, appliances, and services, such as firewalls, anti-virus, intrusion prevention and endpoint security, among others. From the start, the Fortinet vision has been to deliver broad, truly integrated, high-performance security across the IT infrastructure. Its unique security fabric combines Security Processors, an intuitive operating system, and applied threat intelligence to give customers security, exceptional performance, and better visibility and control–while providing easier administration.

Google Cloud Platform, offered by Google, is a suite of cloud computing services that runs on the same infrastructure that Google uses internally for its end-user products, such as Google Search and YouTube. Alongside a set of management tools, it provides a series of modular cloud services including computing, data storage, data analytics and machine learning.

IBM Cloud is a suite of cloud computing services from IBM that offers both platform as a service (PaaS) and infrastructure as a service (IaaS). With IBM Cloud IaaS, organizations can deploy and access virtualized IT resources — such as compute power, storage and networking — over the internet. For compute, organizations can choose between bare-metal or virtual servers.

Infoblox is recognized by Gartner as an industry leader in the DDI solutions space. Infoblox automates network-control functions to reduce costs and helps protect against DDoS attacks and malware. Infoblox is well-known for its user-friendly GUI, amount of IT managers familiar with the product, and its integration with cloud and virtualization solutions.

At Juniper, we strive to deliver network experiences that transform how people connect, work and live.

Juniper leads the market in next generation wired and wireless access networks. Our solutions power the connections that matter most – from retail, education and healthcare to secure banking. Gartner recognizes us as the leaders in Wired and Wireless Magic Quadrant, and our commitment is to advance real outcomes for network teams and every individual they serve.

It’s that simple.

NetApp, a leader in the 2016 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Solid State Arrays, delivers software, systems and services to manage and store customers’ data, including its proprietary Data ONTAP operating system. NetApp helps enterprises and service providers envision, deploy, and evolve their IT environments. Customers also benefit from the open collaboration with other technology leaders to create the specific solutions they need.

OTAVA® is a global, recognized leader in delivering secure multi-cloud solutions with a personal touch. Its extensive portfolio is powered by world-class technology partners, backed with expert intelligence, and tailored to help businesses and service providers achieve their individual goals while protecting mission-critical data. With its flexible solutions, fortified security, colocation offerings, and professional services, OTAVA empowers its clients with everything they need to thrive in the cloud and stay focused on what they do best.

Riverbed helps consolidate your edge IT footprint by centralizing all data in the secure data center or cloud—without impacting its availability or application performance. Riverbed provides real-time insights of what’s running across your infrastructure so IT can spot risks before they become bigger problems. Actionable insights help protect against inbound DDoS attacks, data exfiltration, and other threats. Pairing that visibility with powerful network forensics—across all flows and devices—helps IT identify, respond to, and contain attacks quicker.

Veeam has been regarded as a leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Enterprise Backup Software and Integrated Appliances for five consecutive years. Veeam provides world-class cloud storage and backup solutions to more than 400,000 customers globally through more than 34,000 partners.

VMware is the unchallenged industry leader in cloud virtualization solutions. It has been recognized as a leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for x86 Server Virtualization Infrastructure six years running. In 2015, VMware vCloud Air was positioned as a visionary in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for IaaS solutions.
